tier.item: (1) a. Qui est mort? ­ Il y a Michel qui est mort.
'Who is dead? ­ There's Michel that is dead'
(1) a. Qui est mort? ­ Il y a Michel qui est mort.
'Who is dead? ­ There's Michel that is dead'
Qui est mort? ­ Il y a Michel qui est mort.
Who is dead? ­ There's Michel that is dead
b. Ah! Mon dieu! dit-il, Monsieur Michel qui est mort!
'Oh, my God! said he, Mr. Michel that is dead!'
(Sandfeld, 1965, p.155)

tier.item: (7) Marie m'a annonce que, malheureusement pour moi, je n'avais pas ete elu.
Je lui ai explique que cela m'arrangeait plutot, vu que je n'avais jamais eu
l'intention de prendre le poste.
"Marie announced that, unfortunately for me, I hadn't been elected. I ex-
plained that it was fine with me, since I never intended to accept the posi-
tion."
(7) Marie m'a annonce que, malheureusement pour moi, je n'avais pas ete elu.
l'intention de prendre le poste.
"Marie announced that, unfortunately for me, I hadn't been elected. I ex-
plained that it was fine with me, since I never intended to accept the posi-
tion."
Marie m'a annonce que, malheureusement pour moi, je n'avais pas ete elu.
l'intention de prendre le poste.
Marie announced that, unfortunately for me, I hadn't been elected. I ex- plained that it was fine with me, since I never intended to accept the posi- tion.

(6) Hanako wa tonari no ie ni sunde iru. Mado ga aite iru koto wa yoku aru.
Demo, Hanako no koe ga kikoeta koto wa ichido mo nai.
(`Hanako lives in the house next door. There have been many occasions
when the window was open. But there has never been an occasion when
Hanako's voice was heard.')
(6) Hanako wa tonari no ie ni sunde iru. Mado ga aite iru koto wa yoku aru.
Demo, Hanako no koe ga kikoeta koto wa ichido mo nai.
(`Hanako lives in the house next door. There have been many occasions
when the window was open. But there has never been an occasion when
Hanako's voice was heard.')
Hanako wa tonari no ie ni sunde iru. Mado ga aite iru koto wa yoku aru. Demo, Hanako no koe ga kikoeta koto wa ichido mo nai.
Hanako lives in the house next door. There have been many occasions when the window was open. But there has never been an occasion when Hanako's voice was heard.

B: (Zusammengearbeitet nicht, aber) ich [kenne]F (zumindest) viele Lin-
(I haven't collaborated with them, but at least) I [know] many lin- guists, who work on IV2.
(33) a. Ich kenne viele / drei Linguisten, (/) die haben rote Haare.
I know many / three linguists that have red hair.
